description.narrative: Enhancing subnational authorities capacities to engage in holistic, area-based planning and consider different scenarios that respond to the needs of host, refugee and IDP populations, including through increasingly responsive service delivery

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1-1: Number of families assessed through the rapid vulnerability assessment tool and identified as being vulnerable 1-2: Number of agreements made with local authorities on houses and infrastructure to be rehabilitated 2-1: a) Number of small-scale community water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) infrastructure rehabilitated in the selected municipalities; b) Number of houses connected to a reliable water network to facilitate clean drinking and handwashing for hygiene purposes in light of ongoing COVID-19 pandemic; c) Number of PPE kits distributed, including surgical and N95 masks, gloves boxes, gowns, goggles, face shields and sanitation equipment (COVID-related); d) Number of service providers’ staff trained on operation and maintenance of the WASH infrastructure 2-2: a) Number of housing units rehabilitated in the selected municipalities (UN-Habitat); b) Number of occupancy rights agreements between house owners and tenants in the selected municipalities (UN-Habitat)

comment.narrative: 1-1 and 1-2 completed in 2019 2-1: a) At least 1 WASH infrastructure rehabilitation project implemented in each of 5 selected municipalities (by the end of Year 2, 2020) b) 300 houses per municipality have direct access to clean and regular supply water for drinking and hygiene purposes, benefiting an average of 1,800 persons per municipality (average 6 people per household x 5 municipalities = 9,000 people) c) At least 100 PPE kits distributed for municipal staff in each of 5 selected municipalities by end of 2020 d) At least 5 staff members trained from each of 5 selected municipalities (by the end of Year 2) 2-2: a) 947 houses (2020) b) At least 200 occupancy rights agreements between house owners and tenants in the 5 selected municipalities (by the end of Year 2, 2020)

1-1 and 1-2 completed in 2019 2-1: a) 4 WASH infrastructure community projects completed in Erbil, Duhok, Sumel and Sinjar b) 1,763 houses have been connected to the water network, providing access to clean and regular water supply to 10,578 persons in the 5 cities c) 128 PPE kits, including hand sanitizers, distributed per municipality (total 640 sets) d) 0 staff members trained 2-2: a) 401 houses completed and handed over to beneficiaries. b) 234 occupancy rights agreements

1-1 and 1-2 completed in 2019 2-1: a) At least 1 WASH infrastructure rehabilitation project implemented in each of 5 selected municipalities (by the end of Year 2, 2020) b) 300 houses per municipality have direct access to clean and regular supply water for drinking and hygiene purposes, benefiting an average of 1,800 persons per municipality (average 6 people per household x 5 municipalities = 9,000 people) c) At least 100 PPE kits distributed for municipal staff in each of 5 selected municipalities by end of 2020 d) At least 5 staff members trained from each of 5 selected municipalities (by the end of Year 2) 2-2: a) 947 houses (2020) b) At least 200 occupancy rights agreements between house owners and tenants in the 5 selected municipalities (by the end of Year 2, 2020)

1-1 and 1-2 completed in 2019 2-1: a) 5 WASH infrastructure community projects completed in Erbil, Duhok, Sumel, Mosul and Sinjar b) 1,843 houses have been connected to the water network, providing access to clean and regular water supply to 11,058 persons in the 5 cities c) An average of 382 PPE kits, including hand sanitizers, distributed per municipality (total 1,910 sets) d) 25 staff members trained (5 for each municipality) 2-2 a) 976 houses completed and handed over to beneficiaries b) completed in 2020
1-1: 200 vulnerable families identified in each of 5 selected municipalities (by the end of Year 1, 2019) 1-2: 1 agreement made with each of 5 selected municipalities (by the end of Year 1)

1-1: An average of 367 vulnerable households have been assessed through SEVAT in each of the 5 cities, 200 households were then prioritized in each municipality for rehabilitation 1-2: 5 agreements, one per municipality
